ds.util
Class Heaps

java.lang.Object
  ds.util.Heaps

public class Heaps
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains the heap methods popHeap,pushHeap, and heapsort.

See Also:
Comparator

Heaps

public Heaps()
Method Detail

pushHeap

public static <T> void pushHeap(T[] arr,
                                int last,
                                T item,
                                Comparator<? super T> comp)
Assuming the array elements in the range [0, last-1) are a heap, the method inserts item into the heap so that the range [0, last) is a heap; the Comparator comp performs the comparisons.

Parameters:
arr - the heap array
last - upper bound for the heap after item is added.
comp - Comparator that specifies ordering among the elements.

popHeap

public static <T> T popHeap(T[] arr,
                            int last,
                            Comparator<? super T> comp)
Assuming the array elements in the range [0, last) are a heap, the method removes the element at index 0 and returns its value; the elements in the range [0, last-1) is a heap; the Comparator comp performs the comparisons.

Parameters:
arr - the heap array
last - upper bound for the heap before removing the first element.
comp - Comparator that specifies ordering among the elements.

makeHeap

public static <T> void makeHeap(T[] arr,
                                Comparator<? super T> comp)
Arranges the array elements into a heap; the Comparator comp performs the comparisons.

Parameters:
arr - an array to reordered as a heap.
comp - Comparator that specifies ordering among the elements.

heapSort

public static <T> void heapSort(T[] arr,
                                Comparator<? super T> comp)
The generic heapSort the orders an array of elements of type T into ascending order using the Comparator comp to provide the natural ordering of elements. If comp is an instance of Greater, the array is sorted in ascending order. If comp is an instance of Lessthe array is sorted in descending order.

The sorting algorithm is has runtime efficiency O(n*log(n)) for the average case..

Parameters:
arr - the array to be sorted.
comp - a Comparator that provides order for the sort; An instance of Greater sorts in ascending order; an instance of Lesssorts in descending order.

displayHeap

public static java.lang.String displayHeap(java.lang.Object[] arr,
                                           int n,
                                           int maxCharacters)
Returns a string that gives a level-order display of the heap; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the values in the heap.

Parameters:
arr - the array whose sublist [0,n) is a heap.
n - upper bound for the sublist [0,n) which is a heap.
maxCharacters - an upper bound on the string length of the elements in the heap.
Returns:
string that gives a level-order display of the heap.

drawHeap

public static void drawHeap(java.lang.Object[] arr,
                            int n,
                            int maxCharacters)
Displays a single heap in a graphical window and then disposes of the window; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the elements in the heap.

Parameters:
arr - the array whose sublist [0,n) is a heap.
n - upper bound for the sublist [0,n) which is a heap.
maxCharacters - an upper bound on the string length of the elements in the heap.

drawHeaps

public static void drawHeaps(java.lang.Object[] arr,
                             int n,
                             int maxCharacters)
Displays a heap in a graphical window but keeps active the window for a new frame the becomes available after pressing the ENTER key; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the heap values.

Parameters:
arr - the array whose sublist [0,n) is a heap.
n - upper bound for the sublist [0,n) which is a heap.
maxCharacters - an upper bound on the string length of the elements in the heap.
